name: PublishPipelineArtifact
description: Publish (upload) a file or directory as a named artifact for the current run
helpMarkDown: Publish (upload) a file or directory as a named artifact for the current run. Published artifacts can be downloaded in other jobs, stages, or pipelines using the "Download pipeline artifact" task.
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: path
inputs.label: File or directory path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The path of the file or directory to publish. Can be absolute or relative to the default working directory. Can include [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988), but wildcards are not supported.

inputs.name: artifactName
inputs.label: Artifact name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the artifact to publish. If not set, defaults to a unique ID scoped to the job.

inputs.name: artifactType
inputs.label: Artifact publish location
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose whether to store the artifact in Azure Pipelines, or to copy it to a file share that must be accessible from the pipeline agent.

inputs.name: fileSharePath
inputs.label: File share path
inputs.helpMarkDown: The file share to which the artifact files will be copied. This can include variables. Example: \\\\my\\share\\$(Build.DefinitionName)\\$(Build.BuildNumber). Publishing artifacts from a Linux or macOS agent to a file share is not supported.

inputs.name: parallel
inputs.label: Parallel copy
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select whether to copy files in parallel using multiple threads for greater potential throughput. If this setting is not enabled, one thread will be used.

inputs.name: parallelCount
inputs.label: Parallel count
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the degree of parallelism, or number of threads used, to perform the copy. The value must be at least 1 and not greater than 128.
